intro: Monnina ligustrina, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture. Monnina ligustrina is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
